text pane was present, but the editor tab was not yet drawn, and a build was 
going on in the background.

SSQ, I'm out of ideas on this one.  Am I missing something simple?

More or less the same scenario with i200405190010. Build was going on in
background, pressed ctrl-O and nothing happened. Later I noticed the NPE in the
log. I am adding part of my stack trace (where line numbers differ - what is
normal, since some code has changed between the two builds).

This is a mystery that we need to get to the bottom of.

I saw it at that time and never saw it again. I have both English and Portuguese
input languages in my Windows XP. For Portuguese, I have two different layouts
for Portuguese: US International and Portuguese (Brazilian ABNT2), since at home
I have a Brazilian keyboard. I alternate between languages/keyboard layouts
often, so I have no idea which ones I were using at that time.
May be the same root cause for bug 36729 (PeekMessage).
*** Bug 67223 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed > 20040615

The problem is that PeekMessage() allows cross thread SendMessage() calls to 
be delivered.  If the message runs an SWT listeners, widgets could be 
disposed.  Among other messages, WM_ACTIVATE can be cross thread.  I'm not 
sure that the WM_ACTIVATE was the message in question because by the time we 
notice that something is wrong (ie the widget is disposed), the cross thread 
SendMessage() has been executed.

Forgot to say that the fix was to call PeekMessage() with flags to disallow 
cross thread SendMessage() calls.
*** Bug 67441 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
